intro: Oreocharis concava var. concava, commonly known as the narrow-leafed oreocharis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It grows in rocky or mountainous habitats and is often found in moist, shaded environments. This variety is distinguished by its narrow leaf shape and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
